alert.note: Alert for Sacramento (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 10:05AM PST until January 03 at 2:30PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST TUESDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring along the Cosumnes and Mokelumne rivers. * WHERE...Portions of Southern Sacramento County. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying areas, along and near the Cosumnes and Mokelumne rivers. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings with water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 939 AM PST, Sacramento County Office of Emergency Services reported continued flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cosumnes River, Mokelumne River, Dry Creek, Deer Creek, Badger Creek, and Morrison Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wilton, Bruceville, Courtland, Point Pleasant, Glanville Track, and Franklin Pond. - Other low-lying locations along Highway 99 west toward Interstate 5 between Elk Grove and Galt may also see flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
